Physics (Properties of Matter).subject: Physics (Properties of Matter)
Physics (Properties of Matter).question: The spring constant of a spring depends on its
options: thickness, its diameter and its material
Physics (Properties of Matter).answer: thickness, its diameter and its material
Physics (Properties of Matter).explanation: F = – kx; k = spring constant and it measures stiffness or softness of spring. Hence. K depends on length, radius and material of the spring.

Physics (Modern Physics).subject: Physics (Modern Physics)
Physics (Modern Physics).question: In a bipolar junction transistor
options: all the three regions (the emitter, , the base and the collector) have equal concentrations of impurity
the emitter has the least concentration of impurity
the collector has the least concentration of impurity
the base has the least concentration of impurity
Physics (Modern Physics).answer: all the three regions (the emitter, , the base and the collector) have equal concentrations of impurity
Physics (Modern Physics).explanation: A Bipolar Junction Transistor, or BJT, is a solid-state device in which the current flow between two terminals (the collector and the emitter) is controlled by the amount of current that flows through a third terminal (the base).

Physics (Modern Physics).subject: Physics (Modern Physics)
Physics (Modern Physics).question: The energy of a photon, whose momentum is 10 MeV/ c, where c is the speed of light, is given by
Physics (Modern Physics).explanation: As per the formula Energy of Photon is always equal to the multiple of the Momentum and Speed of light. Therefore; P=E/C Where P is Momentum, E is Energy and C is Speed of Light. 10 MeV/C=E/C ;{P (Momentum) = 10MeV/C; as given in Question}. E= 10 MeV

Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question: The pressure exerted by a 760 mm column of mercury at 0°C is known as
Physics (Mechanics).explanation: 76cm Hg = 760 mmHg = 1 atm = 101325 Pa (mmHg = milimeters of mercury) (atm = atmosphere) (Pa = Pascal = N/m2, SI unit for pressure)

Physics (Units & Dimensions).subject: Physics (Units & Dimensions)
Physics (Units & Dimensions).question: Which one of the following physical quantities has the same dimensions as that of Planck's constant h?
Physics (Units & Dimensions).explanation: The dimension of Plank's contant can be obtained from any of the equations in which it appears, e.g. h = E/n, l = h/p, etc. Planck's Constant h = 6.626176 × 10–34 joule-second = 6.626176 × 10–34 m2 kg/s. [h] = [M L2 T–1]. Angular momentum l = r × p. [l] = [r] [p] = [L] [M L T–1] = [M L2 T–1]. Compare Eqs. (1) and (2). See that both the Planck's constant and angular momentum have the same dimensions.

Physics (Optics).subject: Physics (Optics)
Physics (Optics).question: In total internal reflection, the light travels from
options: rarer to denser medium and it occurs with no loss of intensity
denser to rarer medium and it occurs with no loss of intensity
rarer to denser medium and it occurs with loss of intensity
denser to rarer medium and it occurs with loss of intensity
Physics (Optics).answer: denser to rarer medium and it occurs with no loss of intensity

Physics (Optics).subject: Physics (Optics)
Physics (Optics).question: Light travels in a straight line (rectilinear propagation of light). This statement does hold if the medium of travel for light is
options: made up of slabs of different refractive indices

Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).subject: Physics (Electricity & Magnetism)
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).question: Liquids and gases never show
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).explanation: Liquids and gases show diamagnetic, paramagnetic and electromagnetic property, but it never show ferromagnetic property.

Ecology.subject: Ecology
Ecology.question: Which one of the following is most sensitive to environmental change?
Ecology.explanation: Environmental changes affecting all regions the world and influence all organisms. Amphibians are one of the most sensitive groups to change, whether that is caused by habitat loss, invasive species, disease, trade or climate change. Nearly 33% of the amphibian species of the world are categorized as threatened on the Red List. Furthermore, given their complex life cycles and other traits, amphibians are often recognized as indicators of ecosystem health.

Health and Disease.subject: Health and Disease
Health and Disease.question: The HIV virus weakens the immunity of a person because it destroys
Health and Disease.explanation: The human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) seeks and destroys CD4+ cells, a type of T lymphocyte (T cell). T cells are critical to the immune system. They're responsible for warding off diseases and most infections, including viral infections.

Health and Disease.subject: Health and Disease
Health and Disease.question: Deficiency of fluoride leads to which one of the following health problems?
Health and Disease.explanation: Fluorine deficiency is a disorder which may cause increased dental caries (or tooth decay, is the breakdown of dental tissues by the acidic products released by the "bacterial fermentation of dietary carbohydrates.") and possibly osteoporosis (a bone disorder which leads to a decrease in bone mass, and an increase in bone fragility), due to a lack of fluoride in the diet.

Environmental Science.subject: Environmental Science
Environmental Science.question: Which one of the following air pollutants combines with the haemoglobin of human blood and reduces its oxygen-carrying capacity, leading to suffocation and may cause even death?
Environmental Science.explanation: Carbon monoxide (CO) has strong affinity to combine/ bind with haemoglobin in blood to form carboxyhaemoglobin, which reduces oxygen carrying capacity of blood to cause headache, nausea, asphyxiation and fainting (low supply of O2 to body though one may inhale normally). Against normal level of 0.5% CO in blood, severe pollution may lead to 8 to 9% CO.

Botany.subject: Botany
Botany.question:
An irregular mode of reproduction resulting in the development of an embryo without fertilization is called
1. Parthenogenesis
2. Apogamy
3. Sporophytic budding
Select the correct answer using the code given below.
Botany.explanation:
Parthenogenesis, a reproductive strategy that involves development of a female (rarely a male) gamete (sex cell) without fertilization. It occurs commonly among lower plants and invertebrate animals (particularly rotifers, aphids, ants, wasps, and bees) and rarely among higher vertebrates.
Apogamy is a type of reproduction, occurring in some ferns, in which the sporophyte develops from the gametophyte without fusion of gametes
Adventive embryony, also called sporophytic apomixis, sporophytic budding, or nucellar embryony: Here there may be a megagametophyte in the ovule, but the embryos do not arise from the cells of the gametophyte; they arise from cells of nucellus or the integument.

Physics (Waves).subject: Physics (Waves)
Physics (Waves).question: Which one of the following statements is not correct?
options: The response of the ear to sound of increasing intensity is approximately logarithmic.
The sensitivity of the human ear does not vary with the frequency of the sound.
When two or more waves traverse the same medium, the displacement of any element of the medium is the algebraic sum of the displacements due to each wave.
Longitudinal waves can travel in all media-solids, liquids and gases.
Physics (Waves).answer: The sensitivity of the human ear does not vary with the frequency of the sound.
Physics (Waves).explanation: The human ear can respond to minute pressure variations in the air if they are in the audible frequency range, roughly 20 Hz - 20 kHz.

Human Physiology.subject: Human Physiology
Human Physiology.question: Which one of the following hormones is essential for the uptake of glucose by cells in the human body?
Human Physiology.explanation: Insulin is a hormone made by the pancreas that allows your body to use sugar (glucose) from carbohydrates in the food that you eat for energy or to store glucose for future use. Insulin helps keeps your blood sugar level from getting too high (hyperglycemia) or too low (hypoglycemia).

Human Physiology.subject: Human Physiology
Human Physiology.question: 'Altitude sickness' is caused at high altitude due to
options: high partial pressure of carbon dioxide
Human Physiology.explanation: Altitude sickness is a disorder caused at high altitude due to low partial pressure of oxygen. Symptoms of altitude sickness include weakness, sleepiness, and lack of appetite.

Cell Biology.subject: Cell Biology
Cell Biology.question:
Which of the following cells do not contain nucleus?
1. Root hair cells
2. Red blood cells
3. Platelets
4. Monocytes
Select the correct answer using the code given below.
Cell Biology.explanation: Prokaryotes (meaning 'before nucleus') are cells without a definite nucleus. The DNA floats in the cytoplasm and they divide through mitosis. RBC and platelets present in eukaryotes also do not have nucleus.

Biochemistry.subject: Biochemistry
Biochemistry.question:
Biological catalysts are protein molecules which
1. speed up a chemical reaction
2. remain unchanged after reaction
3. function optimally at 37°C
4. do not have an enzymatic activity
Select the correct answer using the code given below.
Biochemistry.explanation: Enzymes are soluble protein molecules that can speed up chemical reactions in cells. These reactions include respiration, photosynthesis and making new proteins. For this reason enzymes are sometimes called biological catalysts. These enzymes functions optimally at 37° C and it remains unchanged after reaction.

Biochemistry.subject: Biochemistry
Biochemistry.question: The elemental composition of an adult human body by mass is
Biochemistry.explanation: The elemental composition of an adult human body by mass is O>C>H>N respectively. 99% of the mass of the human bodies are made up of just six elements: oxygen (65%), carbon (18%), hydrogen (9.5%), nitrogen (3.2%), calcium (1.5%), and phosphorus (1.2%).
